Name: Offering Table of Nar-em-Seneb
Description: This huge rectangular offering table was found in the mastaba, or tomb, of Nar-em-Seneb. The table stands on a huge semicylindrical base. Various kinds of offerings such as geese, oxen, bread, and wine, are illustrated on it or depicted as the hieroglyphic signs themselves. Ancient Egyptians depicted these offerings along with the magical formula needed to convert them into real ones to guarantee daily provision of the offerings forever.
